alert.note: Alert for Boone; Kanawha; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Raleigh (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Kanawha, northwestern Raleigh, southwestern Fayette and east central Boone Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 659 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Burnwell, or 17 miles west of Fayetteville, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs, even trees in saturated soils, and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Beckley, Fayetteville, Oak Hill, Mount Hope, Bradley, Prosperity, Burnwell, Powellton, Piney View, Whitesville, Pax, Thurmond, Leewood, Eskdale, Dorothy and Artie. This includes the following highways... West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 46 and 73, and between mile markers 76 and 77. Route 19 between mile markers 1 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to travel across flooded roads. Find alternate routes. It takes only a few inches of swiftly flowing water to carry vehicles away.
